meanings.definition: To delay or be slow in acting or moving.
meanings.sent1: The sleepy cat decided to tarry before getting up from its cozy spot.
meanings.sent2: Don't tarry too long or we might miss the bus!
meanings.sent3: Why do you always tarry when it's time to do your homework?
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him tarry in making important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The snail's pace made it seem like it would tarry forever to reach the finish line.
